Class MessageHeader

  • Object
    • com.lightbend.lagom.javadsl.api.transport.MessageHeader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:

    public abstract class MessageHeader
extends Object
    A message header.

    • Method Detail

      • protocol

        public MessageProtocol protocol()
        Get the protocol of the message.
        Returns:
        The protocol.

      • headers

        public org.pcollections.PMap<String,org.pcollections.PSequence<String>> headers()
        Get the headers for the message. The returned map is case sensitive, it is recommended that you use getHeader instead.
        Returns:
        The headers for this message.

      • getHeader

        public java.util.Optional<String> getHeader(String name)
        Get the header with the given name. The lookup is case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header.
        Returns:
        The header value.

      • withProtocol

        public abstract MessageHeader withProtocol(MessageProtocol protocol)
        Return a copy of this message header with the given protocol.
        Parameters:
        protocol - The protocol to set.
        Returns:
        A copy of the message header with the given protocol.

      • replaceAllHeaders

        public abstract MessageHeader replaceAllHeaders(org.pcollections.PMap<String,org.pcollections.PSequence<String>> headers)
        Return a copy of this message header with the headers replaced by the given map of headers.
        Parameters:
        headers - The map of headers.
        Returns:
        A copy of the message header with the given headers.

      • withHeader

        public abstract MessageHeader withHeader(String name,
                                         String value)
        Return a copy of this message header with the given header added to the map of headers. If the header already has a value, this value will replace it.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header to add.
        value - The value of the header to add.
        Returns:
        The new message header.
